Key Match Events: Alex Hales and Jos Buttler hammered brilliant unbeaten half-centuries as England crushed India by 10 wickets.
Hales smashed seven sixes in his 86 and Buttler, who made 80, hit three in a spellbinding batting performance.
England chased 169 for victory with four overs to spare.
Chris Jordan picked up three wickets for England.
Virat Kohli made his fourth half-century of the tournament and put on a 61-run fourth-wicket stand with Pandya.
Kohli passed 4,000 T20 international runs with a boundary off Liam Livingstone.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England can now become the first team to hold both global trophies in white-ball cricket when they meet Pakistan in Sunday’s final at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
The match was a repeat of the 1992 50-over World Cup final between Pakistan and England, which Pakistan won.
